messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 22/03/2003 10:38:10 Pacific Standard Time,
diamondair@... writes:


> I don't mind listening to different
> genres.
>

IF this is so, then you might try out listening to Natalie McMaster or Ashley
McIsaac, both Canadians I might add, and the music is very fun.
Nancy from BC


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Inspirational violin/fiddle music, suggestions wanted
messages.msgSnippet: The kids and I are taking violin lessons together (their request), and they just started noticing violin/fiddle in music we hear on the radio. They also saw
messages.messageBody:
The kids and I are taking violin lessons together (their request),
and they just started noticing violin/fiddle in music we hear on the
radio. They also saw the dynamic women fiddle players in a Lord of
the Dance DVD. So I've started looking for songs and albums that have
fiddle and/or violin playing that we can listen to that will continue
to inspire us. I downloaded the MP3's for Charlie Daniel's 'The Devil
Went Down to Georgia' and the fiddle duel from Lord of the Dance, but
if anyone has suggestions for other music that showcases the fiddle
or violin, I'd love to hear them. I don't mind listening to different
genres.

Blue Skies,

-Robin-
